intro: Leptocarpus nudiflorus, commonly known as the naked-flowered leptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that lack petals. It typically grows in coastal or brackish wetlands, thriving in saline conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
